intro: Tunica dianthoides, commonly known as the pink rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are basal, opposite, and have a distinctive hairy texture, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Tunica dianthoides is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
